useStmt.citReq:
Publications and research reports based on the Higher Ed database must cite it appropriately. The citation should include the following:
. Minnesota Population Center. IPUMS Higher Ed: Version 1.0 [dataset]. Minneapolis, MN: University of Minnesota, 2016. https://doi.org/10.18128/D100.V1.0
The licensing agreement for use of Higher Ed data requires that users supply us with the title and full citation for any publications, research reports, or educational materials making use of the data or documentation. Please add your citation to the IPUMS bibliography: http://bibliography.ipums.org/
useStmt.conditions:
Users of Higher Ed data must agree to abide by the conditions of use. A user's license is valid for one year and may be renewed. Users must agree to the following conditions:
(1) No fees may be charged for use or distribution of the data. All persons are granted a limited license to use these data, but you may not charge a fee for the data if you distribute it to others.
(2) Cite IPUMS appropriately. For information on proper citation, refer to the citation requirement section of this DDI document.
(3) Tell us about any work you do using the IPUMS. Publications, research reports, or presentations making use of Higher Ed should be added to our Bibliography. Continued funding for the IPUMS depends on our ability to show our sponsor agencies that researchers are using the data for productive purposes.
(4) Use it for GOOD -- never for EVIL.
useStmt.disclaimer: The user of the data acknowledges that the original collector of the data, the authorized distributor of the data, and the relevant funding agency bear no responsibility for use of the data or for interpretations or inferences based upon such uses.

fileTxt.filePlac: IPUMS, 50 Willey Hall, 225 - 19th Avenue South, Minneapolis, MN 55455

var.name: PERSONID
var.labl: Individual identification number
var.txt:
PERSONID is an identification variable constructed by IPUMS using the reference ID variable (REFID) from the public use files. The original variable identifying individuals uniquely across samples is composed of alpha-numerics, whereas PERSONID used an algorithm to create unique numeric values for each individual. Each digit was expanded to 2 digits. Numeric digits were given a leading zero. For example, the digit 2 would be converted to 02. Letters would be converted by the ordinal of the letter plus ten. For example, A would be converted to 11, B to 12, C to 13 and so on. It is possible to identify individuals in different survey years within the same decade.
IPUMS-SESTAT has set PERSONID as a character string for statistical packages to more easily read in the values.
Users should note that some respondents are interviewed over time, allowing the possibility for longitudinal data analysis. Please see our User Note on Longitudinal Data.
var.codInstr: This is a 18-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: REFID
var.labl: Reference ID number (original)
var.txt:
REFID is the original individual reference number constructed by the NSF to identify respondents across surveys. Some cohorts have alphabetic characters in addition to numeric characters, so IPUMS created an entirely numeric version called PERSONID.
Users should note that some respondents are interviewed over time, allowing the possibility for longitudinal data analysis. Please see our User Note on Longitudinal Data.
var.codInstr: This is a 10-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: YEAR
var.labl: Survey year
var.txt: YEAR gives the year in which the survey was administered.
var.codInstr: This is a 4-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: WEIGHT
var.labl: SESTAT weight
var.txt:
WEIGHT is a weight variable specific to SESTAT samples. The original weights for the separate, non-SESTAT surveys were adjusted to create WEIGHT, so that individuals who might have been eligible for more than one survey are not over-represented when analyzing the entire SESTAT file for a particular year.
Users should use WTSURVY for non-SESTAT survey samples.
The original data includes the decimal point and 2 decimal places.
var.codInstr: WEIGHT is an 11-digit numeric variable with a decimal point and 2 decimal places.

var.name: SAMPLE
var.labl: Sample identifier
var.txt:
SAMPLE is an IPUMS-design sample identification number to distinguish each SESTAT sample uniquely.
The sample coding convention is as follows: the left-most digit (or two digits in 4-digit codes) sequentially numbers each iteration of survey waves beginning in 1993, the second from the right digit identifies SESTAT samples with "0", and non-SESTAT (full survey) samples with "1", and the right-most digit corresponds to the survey type, for example, SDR samples have a last digit of 2.

var.name: SURID
var.labl: Survey identifier
var.txt: SURID identifies the survey for which the respondent was interviewed in this particular survey year.

var.name: COHORT
var.labl: Survey cohort
var.txt: COHORT identifies to which survey cohort the respondent belongs. For the National Survey of College Graduates (NSCG), a cohort is selected from the decennial Census or the American Community Survey sample at the beginning of each decade, and the cohort is followed over the decade. New waves of respondents are selected by different sampling methods for the National Survey of Recent College Graduates (NSRCG) and the Survey of Doctorate Recipients (SDR) every 2 to 3 years. The SDR respondents are not interviewed again, but the NSRCG respondents are pooled with the NSCG of that decade and interviewed until the end of the decade. See our User Notes on Sample Design or Longitudinal Data for more details.

var.name: SRVMODE
var.labl: Survey mode
var.txt: SRVMODE describes the way in which the respondent was interviewed for the survey.

var.name: SEQNUM
var.labl: Sequence number
var.txt: SEQNUM is a variable constructed by IPUMS that preserves the original order of records within each sample in the public use files. The sequence number is assigned independently for each survey component of SESTAT files.
var.codInstr: This is a 6-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: AGE
var.labl: Age
var.txt:
AGE is a public use version of the respondent's age at the time of the survey. In most samples, AGE is top-coded at 75 and bottom-coded at 23, 27, or 35.
For SESTAT samples in the years 1993 to 1999, AGE is a recode using the variable BIRYR, which is the respondent's birth year, given in 5-year intervals. The result is that AGE is also given in 5-year intervals, because the recode subtracts the value in BIRYR from the survey year.

var.name: BIRYR
var.labl: Birth year
var.txt:
BIRYR reports the respondent's year of birth within 5-year interval groups.
For samples in years 2001 and onward, BIRYR is calculated by subtracting the respondent's age in AGE from the survey year, and recoded to match the 5-year interval scheme.

var.name: GENDER
var.labl: Gender
var.txt: GENDER indicates whether the respondent identified as male or female.

var.name: MINRTY
var.labl: Minority indicator
var.txt: MINRTY is an indicator variable identifying respondents who self-reported being an ethnic or racial minority.

var.name: RACETH
var.labl: Race/ethnicity
var.txt: RACETH is a recode of the respondent's reported race into public use categories. The specific categories "Asian" and "White" are kept, and other race categories that have fewer cases are grouped into "Under-represented minorities" or "Other".

var.name: BTHUS
var.labl: Place of birth
var.txt: BTHUS reports whether or not the respondent was born in the United States.

var.name: CTZUSIN
var.labl: U.S. citizenship status, binary
var.txt: CTZUSIN is a binary variable that indicates whether or not the respondent is a US citizen or not. The variable CTZUS gives more detail about whether the respondent is a citizen by birth or by naturalization.

var.name: CTZUS
var.labl: Type of US citizen
var.txt: CTZUS reports whether the respondent is a citizen by birth or by naturalization. A similar variable CTZUSIN is a binary variable that indicates whether or not the respondent is a US citizen or not.

catgry.labl: Born in US or US territories

var.name: FNVS
var.labl: Type of visa held when first came to US
var.txt: FNVS describes the respondent's visa category when he/she first came to the US.

catgry.labl: Temporary Resident Visa for study or training

var.name: CHTOT
var.labl: Total number of children
var.txt: CHTOT is an NSF recode variable describing how many children the respondent lived with as part of his/her family.

var.name: CHU2
var.labl: Number of children: under age 2
var.txt: CHU2 gives the number of children under the age of 2 who live with the respondent as of the reference date.

catgry.labl: No children in this age category

var.name: CHU2IN
var.labl: Children indicator: under age 2
var.txt: CHU2IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children under the age of two, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: CH6
var.labl: Number of children: under age 6
var.txt: CH6 gives the number of children under the age of 6 who lived with the respondent, if the respondent reported living with children.

var.name: CH6IN
var.labl: Children indicator: under age 6
var.txt: CH6IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children under the age of 6, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: CH25
var.labl: Number of children: aged 2-5
var.txt: CH25 gives the number of children between the ages of 2 and 5 who live with the respondent as of the reference date.

catgry.labl: No children in this age category

var.name: CH25IN
var.labl: Children indicator: ages 2-5
var.txt: CH25IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children who were between the ages 2 and 5, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: CH611
var.labl: Number of children: aged 6-11
var.txt: CH611 gives the number of children ages 6 to 11 who lived with the respondent, if the respondent reported living with children.

var.name: CH611IN
var.labl: Children indicator: ages 6-11
var.txt: CH611IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children who were between the ages 6 and 11, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: CHUN12
var.labl: Children indicator: under 12
var.txt: CHUN12 indicates whether the respondent lived with a child under age 12.

var.name: CH1217
var.labl: Number of children: aged 12-17
var.txt: CH1217 gives the number of children ages 12 to 17 who lived with the respondent, if the respondent reported living with children.

var.name: CH1217IN
var.labl: Children indicator: aged 12-17
var.txt: CH1217IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children who were between the ages 12 and 17, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: CH1218IN
var.labl: Children indicator: aged 12-18
var.txt: CH1218IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children who were between the ages 12 and 18, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: CH18
var.labl: Number of children: aged 18 or older
var.txt: CH18 gives the number of children ages 18 or older who lived with the respondent, if the respondent reported living with children.

var.name: CH18IN
var.labl: Children indicator: aged 18 or older
var.txt: CH18IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children ages 18 or older, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: CH19IN
var.labl: Children indicator: age 19 or older
var.txt: CH19IN is a binary variable that indicates whether the respondent lived with children ages 19 or older, if the respondent lived with children.

var.name: RESPLCUS
var.labl: Respondent location
var.txt: RESPLCUS indicates whether or not the respondent was located in the US or not, using information from other responses, such as respondent's residence or employer's location.

var.name: CMPRI
var.labl: Reasons for coming to U.S.: most important reason
var.txt: CMPRI reports the factor the respondent considered most important when deciding to come to the United States, if the respondent was a US citizen but not born in the US. Related variables include CMEDU, CMFAM, CMFLD, CMOPP, CMOT, and CMSEC.

var.name: CMSEC
var.labl: Reasons for coming to U.S.: second most important reason
var.txt: CMSEC reports the factor the respondent considered second most important when deciding to come to the United States, if the respondent was a US citizen but not born in the US. Related variables include CMEDU, CMFAM, CMFLD, CMOPP, CMOT, and CMPRI.

var.name: CMEDU
var.labl: Factors important to come to U.S.: educational opportunities
var.txt: CMEDU reports whether or not opportunities for education was a factor in the respondent's decision for coming to the United States, if the respondent was a US citizen but not born in the US. Related variables include CMFAM, CMFLD, CMOPP, CMOT, CMPRI, and CMSEC.

var.name: CMFAM
var.labl: Factors important to come to U.S.: family-related reasons
var.txt: CMFAM reports whether or not family-related reasons were a factor in the respondent's decision for coming to the United States, if the respondent was a US citizen but not born in the US. Related variables include CMEDU, CMFLD, CMOPP, CMOT, CMPRI, and CMSEC.

var.name: CMFLD
var.labl: Factors important to come to U.S.: scientific/professional infrastructure
var.txt: CMFLD reports whether or not scientific or professional infrastructure in the respondent's field were a factor in the respondent's decision for coming to the United States, if the respondent was a US citizen but not born in the US. Related variables include CMEDU, CMFAM, CMOPP, CMOT, CMPRI, and CMSEC.

var.name: CMOPP
var.labl: Factors important to come to U.S.: job/economic opportunities
var.txt: CMOPP reports whether or not job or economic opportunities were a factor in the respondent's decision for coming to the United States, if the respondent was a US citizen but not born in the US. Related variables include CMEDU, CMFAM, CMFLD, CMOT, CMPRI, and CMSEC.

var.name: CMOT
var.labl: Factors important to come to U.S.: other
var.txt: CMOT reports whether a factor other than the ones listed on the questionnaire affected the respondent's decision for coming to the United States, if the respondent was a US citizen but not born in the US. Related variables include CMEDU, CMFAM, CMFLD, CMOPP, CMPRI, and CMSEC.

var.name: BAAYR5
var.labl: Year of first bachelor's degree pre-2003 (5-year intervals)
var.txt: BAAYR5 is the year the respondent was awarded his/her first bachelor's degree, grouped into 5-year intervals. In some samples, the month of the receipt of the first bachelor's degree is available in BAMN. The year of achieving a bachelor's degree without intervals is available in some samples in the variable BAACYR.

var.name: BA03Y5
var.labl: Year of first bachelor degree 2003-onward (5-year intervals)
var.txt:
BA03Y5 is the year the respondent was awarded his/her first bachelor's degree, grouped into 5-year intervals, for samples 2003 and after. For comparable data pre-2003, see BAAYR5.
In some samples, the month of the receipt of the first bachelor's degree is available in BAMN. The year of achieving a bachelor's degree without intervals is available in some samples in the variable BAACYR.

var.name: NBAMED
var.labl: Field of major for first bachelor degree code
var.txt: NBAMED provides a public-use version of respondent's field of major for his/her first bachelor's degree. Related variables include NBAMEDD and NBAMEMG.

catgry.labl: Other biological, agricultural, environmental life sciences

var.name: NBAMEMG
var.labl: Field of major for first bachelor degree (major group)
var.txt: NBAMEMG categorizes the respondent's field of major for his/her first bachelor's degree into eight broad fields. The variable NBAMED provides this information with a finer level of detail.

var.name: BARGN
var.labl: Location of school awarding first bachelor's degree (region)
var.txt: BARGN reports the location of the school from which the respondent received his or her first bachelor's degree.

var.name: BADGRUS
var.labl: Location of school awarding first bachelor degree (US/non-US)
var.txt: BADGRUS reports whether or not the academic institution where the respondent achieved his/her first bachelor's degree is located in the US.

var.name: BAFAST
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Assistantship/work study
var.txt: BAFAST indicates whether or not the respondent depended on financial support from an assistantship or work study during his/her first bachelor's degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFEM, BAFERN, BAFGFT, BAFGRN, BAFLN, BAFOT, and BAFPLN.

var.name: BAFEM
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Employer
var.txt: BAFEM indicates whether or not the respondent depended on financial support from his/her employer during his/her first bachelor's degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFAST, BAFERN, BAFGFT, BAFGRN, BAFLN, BAFOT, and BAFPLN.

var.name: BAFERN
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Earnings from employment
var.txt: BAFERN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on earnings from employment as financial support during his/her first bachelor's degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFAST, BAFEM, BAFGFT, BAFGRN, BAFLN, BAFOT, and BAFPLN.

var.name: BAFGFT
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Gifts
var.txt: BAFGFT indicates whether or not the respondent depended on gifts from parents or other relatives as financial support during his/her first bachelor's degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFAST, BAFEM, BAFERN, BAFGRN, BAFLN, BAFOT, and BAFPLN.

var.name: BAFGRN
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Grants
var.txt: BAFGRN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on tuition waivers, fellowships, grants, or scholarships as financial support during his/her first bachelor's degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFAST, BAFEM, BAFERN, BAFGFT, BAFLN, BAFOT, and BAFPLN.

var.name: BAFLN
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Loans
var.txt: BAFLN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on loans from the academic institution, banks, or government as financial support during his/her first bachelor's degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFAST, BAFEM, BAFERN, BAFGFT, BAFGRN, BAFOT, and BAFPLN.

var.name: BAFOT
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Other
var.txt: BAFOT indicates whether or not the respondent depended on a source of financial support during his/her first bachelor's degree other than the potential sources listed on the questionnaire. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFAST, BAFEM, BAFERN, BAFGFT, BAFGRN, BAFLN, and BAFPLN.

var.name: BAFPLN
var.labl: Financial support for first bachelor degree: Loans from relatives
var.txt: BAFPLN indicates whether or not the respondent depended loans from parents or relatives as financial support during his/her first bachelor's degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include BAFAST, BAFEM, BAFERN, BAFGFT, BAFGRN, BAFLN, and BAFOT.

var.name: DGRDG
var.labl: Type of highest certificate or degree
var.txt: DGRDG reports the type of the respondent's highest postsecondary degree or certificate.

var.name: HDAY5
var.labl: Year of highest degree pre-2003 (5 year intervals)
var.txt: HDAY5 reports the year, recoded to intervals, in which the respondent received his/her highest degree. The variable HD03Y5 provides similar information for different samples.

var.name: HD03Y5
var.labl: Year of highest degree 2003-onward (5 year intervals)
var.txt: HD03Y5 reports the year, in 5-year intervals, in which the respondent received his/her highest degree (for all samples 2003 and after). For the comparable variable pre-2003, see HDAY5.

var.name: NDGMED
var.labl: Field of major for highest degree
var.txt: NDGMED provides the respondent's field of major for his/her highest degree. The variable NDGMEMG provides this information with a broader level of detail.

catgry.labl: Other biological, agricultural, environmental life sciences

var.name: NDGMEMG
var.labl: Field of major for highest degree (major group)
var.txt: NDGMEMG categorizes the field of major for the respondent's highest degree into seven broad fields. The variable NDGMED provides this information with a finer level of detail.

catgry.labl: Biological, agricultural and environmental life sciences

var.name: HDRGN
var.labl: Location of school awarding highest degree
var.txt: HDRGN reports the location of the school from which the respondent received his or her highest degree.

var.name: HDDGRUS
var.labl: School awarding highest degree located in the US
var.txt: HDDGRUS identifies whether or not the academic institution where the respondent received his/her highest degree was located in the United States or not. Due to the sample design of the SDR survey, SDR respondents have all received their doctorate (which is their highest degree) from an institution in the US. See our Survey Designs User Note for more information.

var.name: HDFAST
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: assistantship/work study
var.txt: HDFAST indicates whether or not the respondent depended on financial support from an assistantship or work study during his/her highest post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFEM, HDFERN, HDFGFT, HDFGRN, HDFLN, HDFOT, and HDFPLN.

var.name: HDFEM
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: financial assistance from employer
var.txt: HDFEM indicates whether or not the respondent depended on financial support from his/her employer during his/her highest post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFAST, HDFERN, HDFGFT, HDFGRN, HDFLN, HDFOT, and HDFPLN.

var.name: HDFERN
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: earnings from employment
var.txt: HDFERN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on earnings from employment as financial support during his/her highest post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFAST, HDFEM, HDFGFT, HDFGRN, HDFLN, HDFOT, and HDFPLN.

var.name: HDFGFT
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: gifts
var.txt: HDFGFT indicates whether or not the respondent depended on gifts from parents or other relatives as financial support during his/her highest post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFAST, HDFEM, HDFERN, HDFGRN, HDFLN, HDFOT, and HDFPLN.

var.name: HDFGRN
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: grants
var.txt: HDFGRN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on tuition waivers, fellowships, grants, or scholarships as financial support during his/her highest post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFAST, HDFEM, HDFERN, HDFGFT, HDFLN, HDFOT, and HDFPLN.

var.name: HDFLN
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: loans
var.txt: HDFLN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on loans from the academic institution, banks, or government as financial support during his/her highest post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFAST, HDFEM, HDFERN, HDFGFT, HDFGRN, HDFOT, and HDFPLN.

var.name: HDFOT
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: other
var.txt: HDFOT indicates whether or not the respondent depended on a source of financial support during his/her highest post-secondary degree other than the potential sources listed on the questionnaire. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFAST, HDFEM, HDFERN, HDFGFT, HDFGRN, HDFLN, and HDFPLN.

var.name: HDFPLN
var.labl: Financial support for highest degree: loans from parents, other relatives
var.txt: HDFPLN indicates whether or not the respondent depended loans from parents or relatives as financial support during his/her highest post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include HDFAST, HDFEM, HDFERN, HDFGFT, HDFGRN, HDFLN, and HDFOT.

var.name: SAMEFLD
var.labl: Likelihood of choosing same field of study for highest degree
var.txt: SAMEFLD describes how likely the respondent would be to choose the same field of degree for their highest degree if they had the chance to choose again.

var.name: MRDG
var.labl: Type of degree, most recent degree
var.txt: MRDG indicates the type of degree the respondent received most recently.

var.name: MR03Y5
var.labl: Year of most recent degree (5-year intervals, 2003+)
var.txt: MR03Y5 reports the year, in 5-year intervals, in which the respondent received his/her most recent degree, post 2003. MR5YR reports similar information, but prior to 2003.

var.name: MR5YR
var.labl: Year of most recent degree (5-year intervals, pre-2003)
var.txt: MR5YR reports the year, recoded to intervals, in which the respondent received his/her most recent degree. MR5YR is only available for samples prior to 2003, but the variable MR03Y5 also provides similar information for 2003-onward.

var.name: NMRMEDR
var.labl: Field of major for most recent degree
var.txt: NMRMEDR provides a public-use version of respondent's field of study of major for most recent degree. The related variable NMRMEMG provides a more general categorization of the information found in NMRMEDR.

catgry.labl: Other biological, agricultural, environmental life sciences

var.name: NMRMEMG
var.labl: Field of study of major for most recent degree (major group)
var.txt: NMRMEMG categorizes the field of study of major for the respondent's most recent degree into eight broad fields. The variable NMRMEDR provides this information with a finer level of detail.

var.name: MRRGN
var.labl: Location of school awarding most recent degree
var.txt: MRRGN reports the location of the academic institution from which the respondent received his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The geographic level is at the US region level, with a category to identify institutions outside of the US.

var.name: MRDGRUS
var.labl: School awarding most recent degree located in the US
var.txt: MRDGRUS reports whether or not the academic institution from which the respondent received his/her most recent post-secondary degree was located in the United States.

var.name: MRFAST
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: assistantship/work study
var.txt: MRFAST indicates whether or not the respondent depended on financial support from an assistantship or work study during his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFEM, MRFERN, MRFGFT, MRFGRN, MRFLN, MRFOT, and MRFPLN.

var.name: MRFEM
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: financial assistance from employer
var.txt: MRFEM indicates whether or not the respondent depended on financial support from his/her employer during his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFAST, MRFERN, MRFGFT, MRFGRN, MRFLN, MRFOT, and MRFPLN.

var.name: MRFERN
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: earnings from employment
var.txt: MRFERN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on earnings from employment as financial support during his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFAST, MRFEM, MRFGFT, MRFGRN, MRFLN, MRFOT, and MRFPLN.

var.name: MRFGFT
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: gifts
var.txt: MRFGFT indicates whether or not the respondent depended on gifts from parents or other relatives as financial support during his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFAST, MRFEM, MRFERN, MRFGRN, MRFLN, MRFOT, and MRFPLN.

var.name: MRFGRN
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: grants
var.txt: MRFGRN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on tuition waivers, fellowships, grants, or scholarships as financial support during his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFAST, MRFEM, MRFERN, MRFGFT, MRFLN, MRFOT, and MRFPLN.

var.name: MRFLN
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: loans
var.txt: MRFLN indicates whether or not the respondent depended on loans from the academic institution, banks, or government as financial support during his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFAST, MRFEM, MRFERN, MRFGFT, MRFGRN, MRFOT, and MRFPLN.

var.name: MRFPLN
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: loans from parents, other relatives
var.txt: MRFPLN indicates whether or not the respondent depended loans from parents or relatives as financial support during his/her most recent post-secondary degree. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFAST, MRFEM, MRFERN, MRFGFT, MRFGRN, MRFLN, and MRFOT.

var.name: MRFOT
var.labl: Financial support, most recent degree: other
var.txt: MRFOT indicates whether or not the respondent depended on a source of financial support during his/her most recent post-secondary degree other than the potential sources listed on the questionnaire. The respondent was asked to indicate all sources of financial support that applied. Other variables from this survey question include MRFAST, MRFEM, MRFERN, MRFGFT, MRFGRN, MRFLN, and MRFPLN.

var.name: ASDGRI
var.labl: Two-year associates degree
var.txt: ASDGRI indicates whether or not the respondent holds a 2-year associates degree as of the reference week.

var.name: COMCOLI
var.labl: Attended community college
var.txt: COMCOLI indicates whether or not the respondent ever enrolled in courses at a community college.

var.name: CCASDG
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: complete associates degree
var.txt: CCASDG indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes as part of an advanced placement program in high school. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCBSDG, CCCHGFL, CCCOLPR, CCFIN, CCGED, CCINT, CCOT, CCPRAD, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCBSDG
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: complete credit towards bachelors degree
var.txt: CCBSDG indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes in order to complete credits towards a bachelor's degree. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCCHGFL, CCCOLPR, CCFIN, CCGED, CCINT, CCOT, CCPRAD, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCCHGFL
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: change academic/occupational field
var.txt: CCCHGFL indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes in order to change his/her academic or occupational field. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCBSDG, CCCOLPR, CCFIN, CCGED, CCINT, CCOT, CCPRAD, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCCOLPR
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: prepare for college
var.txt: CCCOLPR indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes in order to prepare for college. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCBSDG, CCCHGFL, CCFIN, CCGED, CCINT, CCOT, CCPRAD, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCFIN
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: financial reasons
var.txt: CCFIN indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes for financial reasons. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCBSDG, CCCHGFL, CCGED, CCINT, CCOT, CCPRAD, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCINT
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: leisure
var.txt: CCINT indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes simply for leisure or personal interest. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCBSDG, CCCHGFL, CCCOLPR, CCFIN, CCGED, CCOT, CCPRAD, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCOT
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: other
var.txt: CCOT indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes for a reason other the ones listed on the questionnaire. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCBSDG, CCCHGFL, CCCOLPR, CCFIN, CCGED, CCINT, CCPRAD, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCPRAD
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: increase opportunities for promotion
var.txt: CCPRAD indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes in order to increase opportunities for promotion or advancement. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCBSDG, CCCHGFL, CCCOLPR, CCFIN, CCGED, CCINT, CCOT, and CCSKL. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: CCSKL
var.labl: Reasons attend community college: acquire further skills in field
var.txt: CCSKL indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes in order to acquire further skills in his/her academic or occupational field. Other reasons respondents could have given for taking community college classes can be found in the variables CCADVPL, CCASDG, CCBSDG, CCCHGFL, CCCOLPR, CCFIN, CCGED, CCINT, CCOT, and CCPRAD. The variable CCAFDG indicates whether the respondent was in the universe for this question.

var.name: ACFPT
var.labl: Full-time/part-time student status
var.txt: ACFPT reports whether the respondent was taking courses full-time, part-time, or not enrolled in a degree program even though they were taking classes.

catgry.labl: Not enrolled in a degree program, but taking courses

var.name: ACSIN
var.labl: Taking courses during reference week
var.txt: ACSIN indicates whether the respondent was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program during the reference week.

var.name: ACDRG
var.labl: Type of degree working on during reference week
var.txt: ACDRG gives the type of degree the respondent was working towards during the reference week.

var.name: CCAFDG
var.labl: Took college courses after completing most recent degree
var.txt: CCAFDG indicates whether or not the respondent chose to enroll in community college classes after completing his/her most recent degree.

var.name: TCDG
var.labl: Type of degree working on since after college
var.txt: If the respondent had taken a course after completing his/her college degree, TCDG indicates the type of degree for which the respondent took courses.

var.name: TCDGCM
var.labl: Completed a degree since the last survey
var.txt: TCDGCM reports whether or not the respondent completed a post-secondary degree between the reference month of the survey and the last iteration of that survey, which is typically a period of 2 to 3 years. TCDG indicates the type of degree the respondent was working on since the completed degree the respondent was sampled for.

var.name: TCED
var.labl: Field of major for field of study after most recent degree
var.txt: For respondents who took college courses after completing the sample degree, TCED describes the field of degree of the courses.

var.name: PFMAEDGR
var.labl: Field of study after earning degree
var.txt: If a respondent had taken college-level courses after earning his/her most recent degree, PFMAEDGR indicates the general field of degree to which the courses belonged.

var.name: NACEDMG
var.labl: Field of major for current degree (major code)
var.txt: NACEDMG categorizes the respondent's field of study during the reference week into seven broad fields.

catgry.labl: Biological, agricultural and environmental life sciences

var.name: TCEDNO
var.labl: No primary field of study in courses after college
var.txt: TCEDNO indicates that a respondent who took college courses after his/her most recent degree did not have a primary field of study in those courses.

var.name: ACADV
var.labl: Reasons for taking courses: increase advancement opportunities
var.txt: ACADV indicates whether the reason that the respondent was enrolled in classes in the reference week was to increase opportunities for promotion, career advancement, or a higher salary. The survey question from which ACADV was derived asks the respondent to mark all reasons why he/she was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program. Related variables include ACCAR, ACCHG, ACEM, ACGRD, ACINT, ACLIC, ACOT, ACOTP, and ACSKL.

var.name: ACCAR
var.labl: Reasons for taking courses: further education before career
var.txt: ACCAR indicates whether the reason that the respondent was enrolled in classes in the reference week was to gain further education before beginning a career. The survey question from which ACCAR was derived asks the respondent to mark all reasons why he/she was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program. Related variables include ACADV, ACCHG, ACEM, ACGRD, ACINT, ACLIC, ACOT, ACOTP, and ACSKL.

var.name: ACCHG
var.labl: Reasons for taking courses: facilitate academic/occupational field change
var.txt: ACCHG indicates whether the reason that the respondent was enrolled in classes in the reference week was to change his/her academic or occupational field. The survey question from which ACCHG was derived asks the respondent to mark all reasons why he/she was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program. Related variables include ACADV, ACCAR, ACEM, ACGRD, ACINT, ACLIC, ACOT, ACOTP, and ACSKL.

var.name: ACINT
var.labl: Reason for taking courses during reference week: leisure/personal interest
var.txt: ACINT indicates whether the reason that the respondent was enrolled in classes in the reference week was for leisure or personal interest. The survey question from which ACINT was derived asks the respondent to mark all reasons why he/she was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program. Related variables include ACADV, ACCAR, ACCHG, ACEM, ACGRD, ACLIC, ACOT, ACOTP, and ACSKL.

var.name: ACLIC
var.labl: Reason for taking courses during reference week: licensure/certification
var.txt: ACLIC indicates whether the reason that the respondent was enrolled in classes in the reference week was to attain licensure or a certification. The survey question from which ACLIC was derived asks the respondent to mark all reasons why he/she was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program. Related variables include ACADV, ACCAR, ACCHG, ACEM, ACGRD, ACINT, ACOT, ACOTP, and ACSKL.

var.name: ACOTP
var.labl: Reason for taking courses during reference week: grad school, required by employer, other
var.txt:
ACOTP indicates whether the reason that the respondent was enrolled in classes in the reference week was that his/her employer required it, to prepare for graduate school, or for another reason that was not listed in the questionnaire. The survey question from which ACOTP was derived asks the respondent to mark all reasons why he/she was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program. Related variables include ACADV, ACCAR, ACCHG, ACEM, ACGRD, ACINT, ACLIC, ACOT, and ACSKL.
Users should note that another variable, ACOT, also indicates a reason not listed for the respondent enrolling in classes during the reference week. The difference between the two variables is that in the SESTAT NSCG 2013, the reason "required or expected by employer" was separated into its own category, whereas in ACOTP would include this reason in samples prior to 2013.

var.name: ACSKL
var.labl: Reason for taking courses during reference week: gain further skills in field
var.txt: ACSKL indicates whether the reason that the respondent was enrolled in classes in the reference week was to gain further skills in his/her field. The survey question from which ACSKL was derived asks the respondent to mark all reasons why he/she was taking courses or enrolled in a degree program. Related variables include ACADV, ACCAR, ACCHG, ACEM, ACGRD, ACINT, ACLIC, ACOT, and ACOTP.

var.name: TCEM
var.labl: Reasons for taking courses: expected/required by employer
var.txt: TCEM indicates whether or not the respondent took college courses after his/her most recent degree because his/her employer expected or required them.

var.name: TCGRD
var.labl: Reasons for taking courses: prepare for graduate school
var.txt: TCGRD indicates whether or not the respondent took college courses after his/her most recent degree in order to prepare for graduate school.

var.name: NCBRK
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: needed break
var.txt: NCBRK indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because he/she needed a break. Other variables from this survey question include NCCHG, NCFAM, NCFIN, NCGOAL, NCJOB, NCMOVE, NCTERM, and NCOT.

var.name: NCCHG
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: no longer certain of field
var.txt: NCCHG indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because he/she was no longer certain of the field of study he/she wanted to pursue. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCFAM, NCFIN, NCGOAL, NCJOB, NCMOVE, NCTERM, and NCOT.

var.name: NCFAM
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: family
var.txt: NCFAM indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because of family reasons. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCCHG, NCFIN, NCGOAL, NCJOB, NCMOVE, NCTERM, and NCOT.

var.name: NCFIN
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: financial reasons
var.txt: NCFIN indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because of financial reasons. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCCHG, NCFAM, NCGOAL, NCJOB, NCMOVE, NCTERM, and NCOT.

var.name: NCGOAL
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: achieved educational goals
var.txt: NCGOAL indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because he/she had achieved his/her education goals. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCCHG, NCFAM, NCFIN, NCJOB, NCMOVE, NCTERM, and NCOT.

var.name: NCJOB
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: job
var.txt: NCJOB indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because he/she had a job and/or needed to work. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCCHG, NCFAM, NCGOAL, NCFIN, NCMOVE, NCTERM, and NCOT.

var.name: NCMOVE
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: moved
var.txt: NCMOVE indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because he/she moved and was then unable to continue taking courses at the academic institution he/she had been attending. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCCHG, NCFAM, NCGOAL, NCFIN, NCJOB, NCTERM, and NCOT.

var.name: NCTERM
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: waiting for next school term
var.txt: NCTERM indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses because he/she was waiting for next school term to begin. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCCHG, NCFAM, NCGOAL, NCFIN, NCJOB, NCMOVE, and NCOT.

var.name: NCOT
var.labl: Reasons for not taking courses: other
var.txt: NCOT indicates whether or not the respondent was not taking courses for a reason other than the reasons listed in the questionnaire. Other variables from this survey question include NCBRK, NCCHG, NCFAM, NCGOAL, NCFIN, NCJOB, NCMOVE, NCTERM.

var.name: ACCCEP
var.labl: School-related costs paid by employer
var.txt: ACCCEP indicates that any of the respondent's school-related costs were covered by his/her employer.

var.name: FAAST
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: assistantships/work study
var.txt: FAAST indicates whether or not the respondent relied on assistantship or work study as financial support for taking courses after receiving his/her most recent degree. Related variables describing sources of financial support include FAEM, FAERN, FAGFT, FAGRN, FALN, FAOT, and FAPLN.

var.name: FAEM
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: employer
var.txt: FAEM reports whether or not the respondent relied on financial support from his/her employer in order to take courses since completing a college degree. Related variables about financial support while taking courses after college include FAAST, FAERN, FAGFT, FAGRN, FALN, FAOT, and FAPLN.

var.name: FAERN
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: earnings from employment
var.txt: FAERN reports whether or not the respondent relied earnings from employment as a way to finance enrollment in courses since completing a college degree. Related variables about financial support while taking courses after college include FAAST, FAEM, FAGFT, FAGRN, FALN, FAOT, and FAPLN.

var.name: FAGFT
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: gifts parents/relatives
var.txt: FAGFT reports whether or not the respondent relied on financial support from his/her parents (without the expectation of repayment) in order to take courses since completing a college degree. Related variables about financial support while taking courses after college include FAAST, FAEM, FAERN, FAGRN, FALN, FAOT, and FAPLN.

var.name: FAGRN
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: grants/scholarships/etc.
var.txt: FAGRN reports whether or not the respondent relied on financial support from grants, scholarships, fellowships, or tuition waivers in order to take courses since completing a college degree. Related variables about financial support while taking courses after college include FAAST, FAEM, FAERN, FAGFT, FALN, FAOT, and FAPLN.

var.name: FALN
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: loans from institution
var.txt: FALN reports whether or not the respondent relied on financial support in the form of loans from a bank, government, or the academic institution in order to take courses since completing a college degree. Related variables about financial support while taking courses after college include FAAST, FAEM, FAERN, FAGFT, FAGRN, FAOT, and FAPLN.

var.name: FAOT
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: other
var.txt: FAOT reports whether or not the respondent relied on a source of financial support other than the options listed on the questionnaire in order to take courses since completing a college degree. Related variables about financial support while taking courses after college include FAAST, FAEM, FAERN, FAGFT, FAGRN, FALN, and FAPLN.

var.name: FAPLN
var.labl: Sources of financial support for courses since college: loans from parents/relatives
var.txt: FAPLN reports whether or not the respondent relied on loans from parents as financial support in order to take courses since completing a college degree. Related variables about financial support while taking courses after college include FAAST, FAEM, FAERN, FAGFT, FAGRN, FALN, and FAOT.

var.name: HSYRGR
var.labl: Year received high school diploma (group)
var.txt: HSYRGR reports the year the respondent received his/her high school diploma, in 5-year intervals.

var.name: HSUS
var.labl: Place attended high school (recode)
var.txt: HSUS is a recode indicating whether or not the respondent's high school was located within the United States.

var.name: HSNOI
var.labl: No high school diploma (did not finish high school)
var.txt: HSNOI is an indicator variable that reports whether or not the respondent has a high school diploma. The response categories are somewhat counter-intuitive. The "No" category means that the respondent did finish high school, and a "Yes" response means that the respondent did not finish high school, and therefore has no high school diploma.

catgry.labl: Yes, did not finish high school

var.name: LFSTAT
var.labl: Labor force status
var.txt: LFSTAT is the respondent's labor force status.

var.name: WRKG
var.labl: Working for pay during reference week
var.txt: WRKG indicates whether or not the respondent was working for pay during the survey reference week.

var.name: FPTIND
var.labl: Full-time/part-time status
var.txt: FPTIND indicates whether or not a respondent was working full time or part-time, if he/she was working during the reference week.

var.name: WRKGP
var.labl: Working both current and previous reference weeks
var.txt: WRKGP indicates that the respondent was working for pay both during the current survey's reference period, and during the reference period of the previous survey, typically 2 or 3 years earlier.

var.name: EMSMI
var.labl: Employment status, current and previous reference weeks
var.txt: If the respondent worked during both the reference week and during the same week two years prior, he/she was asked if he/she worked for the same employer and in the same job. EMSMI describes all combinations of the respondent working for the same or a different employer, or the same or a different job.

var.name: EXPFT
var.labl: Full-time, years of professional work experience
var.txt: EXPFT gives the respondent's years of full-time, professional work experience.
var.codInstr: This is a 2-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: EXPPT
var.labl: Part-time, years of professional work experience
var.txt: EXPPT gives the respondent's years of part-time, professional work experience.
var.codInstr: This is a 2-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: HRSWK
var.labl: Principal job hours worked
var.txt: HRSWK reports the number of hours a week that the respondent worked at his/her principal job. HRSWKGR is a similar variable that is gives hours per week worked in hour groups.
var.codInstr: This is a 2-digit numeric variable with 0 implied decimal places

var.name: HRSWKGR
var.labl: Principal job: hours per week typically worked (group)
var.txt: HRSWKGR reports the typical hours per week that the respondent works at his/her principal job categorized into four groups. The variable HRSWK also provides this information for SESTAT samples prior to 2000, however, HRSWK is not intervalled.

var.name: WKSWKGR
var.labl: Principal job weeks salary based on year (group)
var.txt: WKSWKGR reports the interval number of weeks the basic annual salary of the respondent's principal job was based on during a 52-week year, including sick leave and paid vacation.

var.name: JOBINS
var.labl: Available benefits: health insurance
var.txt: JOBINS indicates whether or not the respondent's job provides health insurance. Related variables include JOBPENS, JOBPROFT, and JOBVAC.

var.name: JOBPENS
var.labl: Available benefits: pension/retirement plan
var.txt: JOBPENS indicates whether or not the respondent's job provides a pension or retirement plan. Related variables include JOBINS, JOBPROFT, and JOBVAC.

var.name: JOBPROFT
var.labl: Available benefits: profit-sharing plan
var.txt: JOBPROFT indicates whether or not the respondent's job had a profit-sharing plan. Related variables include JOBPENS, JOBINS, JOBVAC.

var.name: JOBVAC
var.labl: Available benefits: paid vacation/sick/personal days
var.txt: JOBVAC indicates whether or not the respondent's provides paid vacation, sick, and/or personal days. Related variables include JOBPENS, JOBINS, and JOBPROFT.

var.name: LOOKWK
var.labl: Not working, looking for work
var.txt: If the respondent was not working during the reference week, LOOKWK indicates whether or not he/she was looking for work in the four weeks preceding the reference week.

var.name: FINDNO
var.labl: Have not found new job
var.txt: FINDNO indicates whether or not the respondent, who was actively searching for a job, had not found another job at the time of the survey after losing or leaving a job.

catgry.labl: Yes, have not found new job

var.name: FINDTIME
var.labl: Months to find new job
var.txt: FINDTIME reports the number of months of active searching passed before the respondent found another job after losing or leaving a job.

var.name: WORKWANT
var.labl: Preferred type of working arrangement
var.txt: WORKWANT describes the type of work arrangement the respondent preferred, regardless of the type of work arrangement he/she had at the time of the survey.

catgry.labl: Some other type of working relationship

var.name: LOSEJOB
var.labl: Concerned about losing job
var.txt: LOSEJOB indicates whether or not the respondent was concerned about losing his/her job in the next 12 months.

var.name: LOSEYR
var.labl: Year, left/lost job
var.txt: LOSEYR reports the year the respondent lost or left his/her job (referring to the most recent job lost or left since his/her first bachelor's degree) in 5-year intervals.

var.name: LOSECLOS
var.labl: Reasons for losing/leaving job: company closed down
var.txt: If a respondent lost or left a job (as indicated by DOWNSIZE) since his/her first bachelor's degree, LOSECLOS reports whether or not the respondent's company, facility, or agency closed down and caused the loss of the job. LOSECLOS is among a series of variables regarding the reason for the respondent losing his/her job, which also includes LOSEMOVE, LOSEOTHR, LOSEREOR, LOSEREV, LOSESELF, and LOSETAKE.

var.name: LOSEMOVE
var.labl: Reasons for losing/leaving job: company moved
var.txt: If a respondent lost or left a job (as indicated by DOWNSIZE) since his/her first bachelor's degree, LOSEMOVE reports whether or not the respondent's company, facility, or agency moved and caused the loss of the job. LOSEMOVE is among a series of variables regarding the reason for the respondent losing his/her job, which also includes LOSECLOS, LOSEOTHR, LOSEREOR, LOSEREV, LOSESELF, and LOSETAKE.

var.name: LOSEOTHR
var.labl: Reasons for losing/leaving job: other
var.txt: If a respondent lost or left a job (as indicated by DOWNSIZE) since his/her first bachelor's degree, LOSEOTHR reports whether or not a reason other than those listed on the questionnaire caused the respondent to lose his/her job. LOSEOTHR is among a series of variables regarding the reason for the respondent losing his/her job, which also includes LOSECLOS, LOSEMOVE, LOSEREOR, LOSEREV, LOSESELF, and LOSETAKE.

var.name: LOSEREOR
var.labl: Reasons for losing/leaving job: work reorganized/restructured
var.txt: If a respondent lost or left a job (as indicated by DOWNSIZE) since his/her first bachelor's degree, LOSEREOR reports whether or not his/her company's reorganization or restructure caused the loss of the job. LOSEREOR is among a series of variables regarding the reason for the respondent losing his/her job, which also includes LOSECLOS, LOSEMOVE, LOSEOTHR, LOSEREV, LOSESELF, and LOSETAKE.

var.name: LOSEREV
var.labl: Reasons for losing/leaving job: company had insufficient revenue
var.txt: If a respondent lost or left a job (as indicated by DOWNSIZE) since his/her first bachelor's degree, LOSEREV reports whether or not his/her company's insufficient revenue caused the loss of the job. LOSEREV is among a series of variables regarding the reason for the respondent losing his/her job, which also includes LOSECLOS, LOSEMOVE, LOSEOTHR, LOSEREOR, LOSESELF, and LOSETAKE.

var.name: LOSESELF
var.labl: Reasons for losing/leaving job: self-operated business ended
var.txt: If a respondent lost or left a job (as indicated by DOWNSIZE) since his/her first bachelor's degree, LOSESELF reports whether or not his/her self-owned business end caused the loss of the job. LOSESELF is among a series of variables regarding the reason for the respondent losing his/her job, which also includes LOSECLOS, LOSEMOVE, LOSEOTHR, LOSEREOR, LOSEREV, and LOSETAKE.

var.name: LOSETAKE
var.labl: Reasons for losing/leaving job: company taken over
var.txt: If a respondent lost or left a job (as indicated by DOWNSIZE) since his/her first bachelor's degree, LOSETAKE reports whether or not the takeover of his/her company caused the loss of the job. LOSETAKE is among a series of variables regarding the reason for the respondent losing his/her job, which also includes LOSECLOS, LOSEMOVE, LOSEOTHR, LOSEREOR, LOSEREV, and LOSESELF.

var.name: DOWNSIZE
var.labl: Lost or left job due to employer closing or downsizing
var.txt: DOWNSIZE indicates whether the respondent lost or left his/her last job due to an employer closing or downsizing.

var.name: FTPRET
var.labl: Previously retired
var.txt: FTPRET indicates whether or not a respondent, who was working during the reference week, had been retired previously.

var.name: PTRET
var.labl: Reasons for working part-time: retired
var.txt: PTRET indicates whether or not the respondent was working part time because he/she was retired. The following variables indicate other reasons for working part time: PTFAM, PTILL, PTNOND, PTOCNA, PTOTP, and PTSTU.

var.name: PTWTFT
var.labl: Working part-time but wanted to work full-time
var.txt: PTWTFT indicated whether or not respondents who worked part time actually wanted to be working full time.

var.name: PTFAM
var.labl: Reasons for working part-time: family
var.txt: PTFAM indicates that the respondent worked part-time during the reference week because of family reasons. The following variables indicate other reasons for working part time: PTILL, PTNOND, PTOCNA, PTOTP, PTRET, and PTSTU.

var.name: PTILL
var.labl: Reasons for working part-time: illness/disability
var.txt: PTILL indicates whether the respondent was working part time during the reference week because of illness or disability. The following variables indicate other reasons for working part time: PTFAM, PTNOND, PTOCNA, PTOTP, PTRET, and PTSTU.

var.name: PTNOND
var.labl: Reasons for working part-time: not need/want work
var.txt: PTNOND indicates that the respondent worked part time in the reference week because the respondent did not need to or want to work full time. The following variables indicate other reasons for working part time: PTFAM, PTILL, PTOCNA, PTOTP, PTRET, and PTSTU.

var.name: PTOCNA
var.labl: Reasons for working part-time: suitable full-time job not available
var.txt: PTOCNA indicates that the respondent worked part time during the reference week because a suitable full-time job was not available at the time. The following variables indicate other reasons for working part time: PTFAM, PTILL, PTNOND, PTOTP, PTRET, and PTSTU.

var.name: PTOTP
var.labl: Reasons for working part-time: other
var.txt: PTOTP indicates whether there was a reason other than the reasons listed in the questionnaire to explain why the respondent was working part time during the reference week. The following variables indicate other reasons for working part time: PTFAM, PTILL, PTNOND, PTOCNA, PTRET, and PTSTU.

var.name: PTSTU
var.labl: Reasons for working part-time: student
var.txt: PTSTU indicates whether or not the respondent was working part time because he/she was a student during the reference period. The following variables indicate other reasons for working part time: PTFAM, PTILL, PTNOND, PTOCNA, PTOTP, and PTRET.

var.name: OCEDRLP
var.labl: Principal job related to highest degree
var.txt: OCEDRLP describes whether or not the respondent's principal job was related to his/her highest post-secondary degree.

var.name: NOCPR
var.labl: Job code for principal job
var.txt: NOCPR provides the occupation code of the respondent's principal job. The variable NOCPRMG provides the same information at a more aggregated level.

catgry.labl: Top and mid-level managers, executives, administrators
Non-science and engineering pre-college and post-secondary teachers

var.name: NOCPRMG
var.labl: Job code for principal job (major group)
var.txt: NOCPRMG categorizes the occupation code of the respondent's principal job into seven broad fields. The variable NOCPR provides this information with a finer level of detail.

catgry.labl: Biological, agricultural and other life scientists

var.name: OCSEDRL
var.labl: Relationship of second job to highest degree
var.txt: OCSEDRL describes whether or not the respondent's second job was related to his/her highest post-secondary degree.

var.name: OCSI
var.labl: Second job during reference week
var.txt: OCSI indicates whether or not the respondent worked a second job in addition to a principal job during the reference week. The occupation code for this job can be found in the variable OCS.

var.name: OCS
var.labl: Job code for second job
var.txt: OCS reports the respondent's occupation for his/her second job, if he/she held a second job during the reference week.

catgry.labl: Top and mid-level managers, executives, administrators
Teachers, except science and engineering postsecondary

var.name: OCSMG
var.labl: Job code for second job (major group)
var.txt: OCSMG reports the respondent's occupation for his/her second job, if he/she held a second job during the reference week. OCS is a similar variable that is available for a greater number of samples.

var.name: EMSEC
var.labl: Employer sector
var.txt: EMSEC gives the summary level or general version of the sector of the respondent's main employer.

catgry.labl: 2 year college or other school system

var.name: EMSIZE
var.labl: Size of employer
var.txt: EMSIZE describes the size of the respondent's main employer by the number of employees.

var.name: EMBUS
var.labl: Employer: main business
var.txt: EMBUS provides the broad business category to which the respondent's main employer belongs. There are 13 business categories which include agriculture, manufacturing, and health services.

var.name: NEWBUS
var.labl: Principal employer came into being as a new business within last 5 years
var.txt: NEWBUS reports whether or not the respondent's principal employer came into being as a new business within the past 5 years.

var.name: EMUS
var.labl: Employer located in the US
var.txt: EMUS is a binary variable indicating whether the respondent's employer location being in the US or not. A more detailed variable providing similar geographic employer region information is EMRG.

var.name: EMRG
var.labl: US region code for employer
var.txt: EMRG gives the location of the respondent at the geographic level of US region, and identifies non-US employers. The regions correspond to US Census region divisions.

var.name: GOVSUP
var.labl: Federal government support indicator
var.txt: GOVSUP indicates whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the federal government. If yes, the respondent was also asked which department or agency supplied the funding. These answers can be found in a series of variables beginning with "FS" in the "Employment - Other" variable category.

var.name: FSAGR
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Agriculture
var.txt: FSAGR reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Agriculture. FSAGR is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSAID
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: AID
var.txt: FSAID reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Agency for International Development. FSAID is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSCOM
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Commerce
var.txt: FSCOM reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Commerce. FSCOM is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSDED
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Education
var.txt: FSDED reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Education. FSDED is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSDK
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Agency unknown
var.txt: FSDK reports whether or not the respondent knew his/her work was supported by a federal department or agency, but did not know which department or agency. FSDK is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSDOD
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Defense
var.txt: FSDOD reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Defense. FSDOD is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSDOE
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Energy
var.txt: FSDOE reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Energy. FSDOE is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSDOT
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Transportation
var.txt: FSDOT reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Transportation. FSDOT is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSEPA
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: EPA
var.txt: FSEPA reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Environmental Protection Agency. FSEPA is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSHHS
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: HHS
var.txt: FSHHS reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Health and Human Services. FSHHS is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSHUD
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: HUD
var.txt: FSHUD reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Housing and Urban Development. FSHUD is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSINT
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Interior
var.txt: FSINT reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of the Interior. FSINT is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSJUS
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Justice
var.txt: FSJUS reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Justice. FSJUS is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSLAB
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: Labor
var.txt: FSLAB reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Labor. FSLAB is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSNASA
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: NASA
var.txt: FSNASA reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). FSNASA is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSNIH
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: NIH
var.txt: FSNIH reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US National Institutes of Health. FSNIH is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSNRC
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: NRC
var.txt: FSNRC reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US National Regulatory Commission. FSNRC is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSNSF
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: NSF
var.txt: FSNSF reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US National Science Foundation. FSNSF is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSST
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: State
var.txt: FSST reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US State Department. FSST is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: FSVA
var.labl: Federal agency supporting work: VA
var.txt: FSVA reports whether or not the respondent's work was supported by the US Department of Veteran Affairs. FSVA is part of a series of variables that indicate all federal departments and agencies that might have supported the respondent's work.

var.name: WAPRI
var.labl: Most hours, work activity
var.txt: WAPRI categorizes the primary work activity the respondent performs during a typical work week in his/her principal job. Related variables regarding work activities include WAPRSM, WASEC, and WASCSM.

catgry.labl: Design of equipment, processes, structures, models

var.name: WAPRSM
var.labl: Summarized primary work activity
var.txt: WAPRSM identifies a summary-level version of the respondent's primary work activity during a typical work week in his/her principal job. Related variables regarding work activities include WAPRI, WASEC, and WASCSM.

var.name: WASEC
var.labl: Second most hours, work activity
var.txt: WASEC categorizes the secondary work activity the respondent performs during a typical work week in his/her principal job. Related variables regarding work activities include WAPRI, WAPRSM, and WASCSM.

catgry.labl: Design of equipment, processes, structures, models

var.name: WASCSM
var.labl: Summarized secondary work activity
var.txt: WASCSM identifies a summary-level version of the respondent's secondary work activity during a typical work week in his/her principal job. Related variables regarding work activities include WAPRI, WASEC, and WAPRSM.

var.name: PRIAREA
var.labl: Area devoted most hours
var.txt: PRIAREA describes the topic area where the respondent devoted most of his/her work hours.

var.name: ACTCAP
var.labl: Activity, computer applications
var.txt:
ACTCAP indicates whether the work activities in the respondent's primary job involves computer applications. ACTCAP is derived from a question that lists a number of work activities, and the respondent is asked to check a box next to the work activity that occupied at least 10 percent of the respondent's time in a typical work week. Related variables include ACTDED, ACTMGT, ACTRD, ACTRDT, ACTRES, and ACTTCH.
ACTCAP is an NSF recode using information from variables including WACOM.

var.name: ACTDED
var.labl: Activity, development and design
var.txt:
ACTDED indicates whether the work activities in the respondent's primary job involves development and design. ACTDED is derived from a question that lists a number of work activities, and the respondent is asked to check a box next to the work activity that occupied at least 10 percent of the respondent's time in a typical work week. Related variables include ACTCAP, ACTMGT, ACTRD, ACTRDT, ACTRES, and ACTTCH.
ACTDED is an NSF recode using information from variables including WADEV and WADSN.

var.name: ACTMGT
var.labl: Activity, management/sales
var.txt:
ACTMGT indicates whether the work activities in the respondent's primary job involves management and/or sales. ACTMGT is derived from a question that lists a number of work activities, and the respondent is asked to check a box next to the work activity that occupied at least 10 percent of the respondent's time in a typical work week. Related variables include ACTCAP, ACTDED, ACTRD, ACTRDT, ACTRES, and ACTTCH.
ACTMGT is an NSF recode using information from variables including WAMGMT and WASALE.

var.name: ACTRD
var.labl: Activity, research and development
var.txt:
ACTRD indicates whether the work activities in the respondent's primary job involves research and development. ACTRD is derived from a question that lists a number of work activities, and the respondent is asked to check a box next to the work activity that occupied at least 10 percent of the respondent's time in a typical work week. Related variables include ACTCAP, ACTDED, ACTMGT, ACTRDT, ACTRES, and ACTTCH.
ACTRD is an NSF recode using information from variables including WAAPRSH, WABRSH and WADEV.

var.name: ACTRDT
var.labl: Activity, research, development, and teaching
var.txt:
ACTRDT indicates whether the work activities in the respondent's primary job involves research, development, and teaching. ACTRDT is derived from a question that lists a number of work activities, and the respondent is asked to check a box next to the work activity that occupied at least 10 percent of the respondent's time in a typical work week. Related variables include ACTCAP, ACTDED, ACTMGT, ACTRD, ACTRES, and ACTTCH.
ACTRDT is an NSF recode using information from variables including WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WADEV and WATEA.

var.name: ACTRES
var.labl: Activity, research (basic and/or applied)
var.txt:
ACTRES indicates whether the work activities in the respondent's primary job involves basic and/or applied research. ACTRES is derived from a question that lists a number of work activities, and the respondent is asked to check a box next to the work activity that occupied at least 10 percent of the respondent's time in a typical work week. Related variables include ACTCAP, ACTDED, ACTMGT, ACTRD, ACTRDT, and ACTTCH.
ACTRES is an NSF recode using information from variables including WAAPRSH and WABRSH,.

var.name: ACTTCH
var.labl: Activity, teaching
var.txt:
ACTTCH indicates whether the work activities in the respondent's primary job involves teaching. ACTTCH is derived from a question that lists a number of work activities, and the respondent is asked to check a box next to the work activity that occupied at least 10 percent of the respondent's time in a typical work week. Related variables include ACTCAP, ACTDED, ACTMGT, ACTRD, ACTRDT, and ACTRES.
ACTTCH differs from a similar variable WATEA in that ACTTCH is an NSF recode using the same question as WATEA, whereas WATEA is the original response.

var.name: WADEV
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: development
var.txt: WADEV indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in development during a typical work week. In the survey, development is defined as using knowledge gained from research for the production of materials or devices. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WADSN
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: design
var.txt: WADSN indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in designing equipment, processes, structures, and/or models during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WAEMRL
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: employee relations
var.txt: WAEMRL indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in employee relations, including recruiting, personnel development, and training, during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WAMGMT
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: management and administration
var.txt: WAMGMT indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in managing and supervising during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WAOT
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: other
var.txt: WAOT indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in an activity other than the activities listed in the questionnaire during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WAPROD
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: production, operations, maintenance
var.txt: WAPROD indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in production, operations, and maintenance during a typical work week.
