Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WAQM
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: quality or productivity management
var.txt: WAQM indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in quality or productivity management during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WASALE
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: sales, purchasing, marketing
var.txt: WASALE indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job doing sales, purchasing, marketing, customer service, or public relations during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WASVC
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: professional services
var.txt: WASVC indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in professional services, including health care, counseling, legal services, etc, during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, and WATEA.

var.name: WATEA
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: teaching
var.txt:
WATEA indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job teaching during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, and WASVC.
WATEA differs from a similar variable ACTTCH in that WATEA is the original response, whereas ACTTCH is an NSF recode using the same question as WATEA.

var.name: WAACC
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: accounting, finance, contracts
var.txt: WAACC indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in accounting, finance, or contracts during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WAAPRSH
var.labl: Work activities on principal job : applied research
var.txt: WAAPRSH indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in applied research during a typical work week. In the survey, applied research is defined as study directed toward gaining scientific knowledge to meet a recognized need. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WABRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WABRSH
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: basic research
var.txt: WABRSH indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in basic research during a typical work week. In the survey, basic research is defined as study directed toward gaining scientific knowledge for its own sake. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WACOM, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WACOM
var.labl: Work activities on principal job: computer applications
var.txt: WACOM indicates whether or not the respondent spent at least ten percent of time in his/her principal job in computer applications, programming, or systems development during a typical work week. Other variables regarding work activities include WAACC, WAAPRSH, WABRSH, WADEV, WADSN, WAEMRL, WAMGMT, WAOT, WAPROD, WAQM, WASALE, WASVC, and WATEA.

var.name: WKSORG
var.labl: Work on principal job: work with others in same organization
var.txt: WKSORG indicates whether or not the respondent worked with other individuals within the same organization while performing his/her principal job.

var.name: WKTEAM
var.labl: Work on principal job: work with immediate group or team
var.txt: WKTEAM indicates whether or not the respondent worked with an immediate group or team in his/her principal job.

var.name: WKUSORG
var.labl: Work on principal job: work with others in other US organization
var.txt: WKUSORG indicates whether or not the respondent worked with individuals from other organizations in the US in performing his/her principal job during the week of April 1st, 2006.

var.name: SUPWK
var.labl: Supervisory work
var.txt: SUPWK indicates whether or not the respondent supervised other employees as a part of his/her principal job.

var.name: PAPERS
var.labl: Number of papers (co)authored presented
var.txt: PAPERS reports the number of papers the respondent had authored or co-authored that had been presented at conferences since October 1998.
var.codInstr: 6 = 6 or more papers 98 = Logical Skip 99 = Missing

var.name: PPRS95
var.labl: Number of papers presented (intervaled)
var.txt: PPRS95 gives the number of articles the respondent had authored or co-authored that had been published since April 1990.

var.name: PATENT
var.labl: Named as inventor for U.S patent
var.txt: PATENT indicates that the respondent had been named as an inventor for a US patent.

var.name: ARTC95
var.labl: Number of articles authored (intervals)
var.txt: ARTC95 gives the number of articles the respondent has authored or co-authored that have been published as of the reference week, grouped in intervals of 5. The topcode is 51, meaning more than 50 of the respondent's papers were accepted for publication. A similar variable available for other samples is ARTICLE.

var.name: ARTICLE
var.labl: Number of articles authored
var.txt: ARTICLE gives the number of articles the respondent has authored or coauthored that have been accepted for publication as of the reference week. A similar variable is ARTC95.

var.name: PRMBR
var.labl: Number of professional society memberships
var.txt: PRMBR reports the number of professional memberships to which the respondent belonged.

var.name: PROMTGI
var.labl: Attended professional meetings in past year
var.txt: PROMTGI indicates whether or not the respondent attended a professional meeting within the last year.

var.name: BOOKSP
var.labl: Books or monographs (co)authored accepted for publication indicator
var.txt: BOOKSP reports whether or not the respondent had authored or co-authored at least one published book since October 1998

var.name: EXPECTED
var.labl: Work similar to what you expected to be doing
var.txt: EXPECTED describes how closely the respondent's work activities fit their expectations from when he/she first completed his/her highest degree.

catgry.labl: Very similar to what you expected
Somewhat similar to what you expected
Not very similar to what you expected

var.name: SALARY
var.labl: Salary (annualized)
var.txt: SALARY provides the respondent's salary for the principal job. Respondents are asked to report their basic annual salary, excluding deductions, bonuses, overtime or additional compensation for summertime teaching or research. If the respondent is not salaried, they are asked to provide an estimate of their annual earned income, excluding business expenses.
var.codInstr:
SALARY is a 7-digit numeric variable.
9999998 = Logical Skip 9999999 = Missing

var.name: EARN
var.labl: Total earned income before deductions in previous year (public use)
var.txt: EARN provides a public-use and top-coded version of the respondent's earnings before deductions for the year prior to the survey.
var.codInstr:
EARN is a 7-digit numeric variable.
10000 = Bottom code 150000 = Top code 9999999 = Missing

var.name: HHINC
var.labl: Total household income: 1996
var.txt: HHINC reports the total income of the respondent's household.

var.name: CPI2009C
var.labl: CPI conversion factor - current year
var.txt:
CPI2009C provides the CPI-U multiplier (available from the Bureau of Labor Statistics) to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars for variables whose reference year is the survey year (SALARY). Multiplying dollar amounts by this variable (which is constant within years) will render them comparable across time and thus suitable for multivariate analysis.
For variables that have a reference year of the previous year (EARN and HHINC), users should use CPI2009P to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars.
For more information on how to use CPI2009C and CPI2009P, please see the SESTAT inflation adjustment page.
var.codInstr: CodesThis is a 6-digit numeric variable with 3 implied decimal places.

var.name: CPI2009P
var.labl: CPI conversion factor - previous year
var.txt:
CPI2009P provides the CPI-U multiplier (available from the Bureau of Labor Statistics) to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars for variables whose reference year is the previous year (EARN and HHINC). Multiplying dollar amounts by this variable (which is constant within years) will render them comparable across time and thus suitable for multivariate analysis.
For variables that have a reference year of the survey year (SALARY), users should use CPI2009C to convert dollar figures to constant 2009 dollars.
For more information on how to use CPI2009P and CPI2009C, please see the SESTAT inflation adjustment page.
var.codInstr: CodesThis is a 6-digit numeric variable with 3 implied decimal places.

var.name: ALTANY
var.labl: Alternative work arrangement
var.txt: ALTANY indicates whether or not the respondent has an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week. This variable has a value of yes if the respondent reported having a type of relationship with his/her principal employer such as being self-employed, job-sharing, working from home, etc. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTELSE, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: ALTPRI
var.labl: Main reason for alternative work arrangement
var.txt: ALTPRI gives the respondent's reported primary reason for a temporary or alternative work arrangement. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTSEAS, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

catgry.labl: Only type of work you could find
Gain experience that might lead to a permanent job
In school or some type of training program
Employer changed your status to temporary

var.name: ALTSEC
var.labl: Second most important reason for alternative work arrangement
var.txt: ALTSEC gives the respondent's reported second most important reason for a temporary or alternative work arrangement. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTSEAS, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

catgry.labl: Only type of work you could find
Gain experience that might lead to a permanent job
In school or some type of training program
Employer changed your status to to temporary

var.name: ALTBOSS
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: own boss
var.txt: ALTBOSS indicates if a respondent reported that he/she chose to have an alternative work arrangement because he/she enjoyed being their own boss, that is, that the respondent is self-employed. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTEXP
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: gain experience
var.txt: ALTEXP indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week in order to gain experience that might lead to a permanent job. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTFAM
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: family-related reasons
var.txt: ALTFAM indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because of family-related reasons. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTFLEX
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: schedule flexibility
var.txt: ALTFLEX indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week to have schedule flexibility. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTOTHR
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: other
var.txt: ALTOTHR indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week for some reason other than the reasons listed. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTPAY
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: better pay
var.txt: ALTPAY indicates that the respondent chose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week for better pay. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTSTAT, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTSTAT
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: status changed to temporary
var.txt: ALTSTAT indicates that the respondent had an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because the principal employer changed the respondent's status to temporary. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTTRAIN
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: school or training program
var.txt: ALTTRAIN indicates that the respondent had an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because respondent was in school or some type of training program. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, and ALTTYPE. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTTYPE
var.labl: Reason for alternative work arrangement: only type of work I could find
var.txt: ALTTYPE indicates that the respondent had an alternative or temporary work arrangement during the reference week because it was the only type of work the respondent could find. Other variables giving other reasons why respondents have alternative work arrangements include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTOTHR, ALTPAY, ALTSTAT, and ALTTRAIN. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement.

var.name: ALTHOME
var.labl: Relationship with principal employer: work from home
var.txt: ALTHOME indicates that a respondent works from home for half or more of his/her work time for an alternative or temporary work arrangement. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: ALTOUT
var.labl: Relationship with principal employer: work contracted out by employer
var.txt: ALTOUT indicates that a respondent's primary employer contracted out his/her services to other organizations, which is considered an alternative or temporary work arrangement. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTOTHR, ALTHOME, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: ALTELSE
var.labl: Relationship with principal employer: other
var.txt: ALTELSE indicates that a respondent reported having an alternative or temporary work arrangement other than the options listed on the survey. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEAS, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: ALTSEAS
var.labl: Relationship with principal employer: short term
var.txt: ALTSEAS indicates that a respondent works on a seasonal or short term basis. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSELF, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: ALTSELF
var.labl: Relationship with principal employer: self-employed
var.txt: ALTSELF indicates that a respondent is self-employed, which is considered an alternative work arrangement. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSEAS, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: ALTSHARE
var.labl: Relationship with principal employer: job sharing
var.txt: ALTSHARE indicates that a respondent does job-sharing, which is considered an alternative work arrangement. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSEAS, ALTSELF, ALTSTAT, ALTTEMP, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: ALTTEMP
var.labl: Relationship with principal employer: temp/employment agency
var.txt: ALTTEMP indicates that a respondent was working through a temporary help or employment agency during the reference week, which is considered an alternative work arrangement. The variable ALTANY identifies respondents who reported to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement. Related variables that identify the type of alternative or temporary work arrangement or the reason why they choose to have an alternative or temporary work arrangement include ALTBOSS, ALTEXP, ALTFAM, ALTFLEX, ALTELSE, ALTHOME, ALTOTHR, ALTOUT, ALTPAY, ALTPRI, ALTSEC, ALTSEAS, ALTSHARE, ALTSTAT, ALTSELF, ALTTRAIN, and ALTTYPE.

var.name: AREAAM95
var.labl: Area or tech used during typical week: advanced materials
var.txt:
AREAAM95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with advanced materials in a typical week.
Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

var.name: AREAB95
var.labl: Area or tech used during typical week: biotech
var.txt:
AREAB95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with biotechnology in a typical week.
Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

var.name: AREAHC95
var.labl: Area or tech used during typical week: high performance computing
var.txt:
AREAHC95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with high-performance computers in a typical week.
Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

var.name: AREAMS95
var.labl: Area or tech used during typical week: semiconductor devices
var.txt:
AREAMS95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with semiconductor devices in a typical week.
Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

var.name: AREAR95
var.labl: Area or tech used during typical week: flexible manufacturing, robotics
var.txt:
AREAR95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with flexible manufacturing or robotics in a typical week.
Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

var.name: AREASF95
var.labl: Area or tech used during typical week: software producibility
var.txt:
AREASF95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with software producibility in a typical week.
Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

var.name: AREASP95
var.labl: Area or tech used during typical week: sensor and signal processing
var.txt:
AREASP95 reports whether or not the respondent, who works in research, development, and/or design, worked with sensor or signal processing in a typical week.
Users should note that the universe described by the original documentation does not exactly fit the number of logical skip cases for this variable.

var.name: ENACT
var.labl: Energy-related activity most involved in work
var.txt: If a respondent reported to spending most of his/her work hours in energy or fuel, ENACT specifies the energy-related activity that the respondent performs.

catgry.labl: Conservation, utilization, management, or storage of energy or fuel

var.name: ENSRC
var.labl: Energy source involved most
var.txt: If a respondent reported to spending most of his/her work hours in energy or fuel, ENSRC specifies which type of energy the respondent works with.

var.name: NRREA
var.labl: Most important reason for working outside field of highest degree
var.txt: NRREA reports the most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. The variable NRSEC reports the second most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree.

catgry.labl: Change in career or professional interests
Job in highest degree field not available

var.name: NRSEC
var.labl: Second most important reason for working outside field of highest degree
var.txt: NRSEC reports the second most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. The variable NRREA reports the most important reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree.

catgry.labl: Change in career or professional interests
Job in highest degree field not available

var.name: NRCHG
var.labl: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: career change
var.txt: NRCHG indicates whether or not the career change was one reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

var.name: NRCON
var.labl: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: working conditions
var.txt: NRCON indicates whether or not working conditions were a reason that the respondent was working in a field unrelated to the field of his/her highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRFAM, NRLOC, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

var.name: NRFAM
var.labl: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: family-related reasons
var.txt: NRFAM indicates whether or not family was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRLOC, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

var.name: NRLOC
var.labl: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: job location
var.txt: NRLOC indicates whether or not job location was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NROCNA, NRPAY and NROT.

var.name: NROCNA
var.labl: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: suitable job not available
var.txt: NROCNA indicates whether or not the fact that no suitable job available was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NRPAY and NROT.

var.name: NROT
var.labl: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: Other
var.txt: NROT indicates whether or not other reason was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NRPAY and NROCNA.

var.name: NRPAY
var.labl: Reason for working outside field of highest degree: pay/promotion
var.txt: NRPAY indicates whether or not pay or promotion was one reason for working outside field of the respondent's highest degree. Other variables from this survey question include NRCHG, NRCON, NRFAM, NRLOC, NROCNA and NROT.

var.name: JOBSATIS
var.labl: Job satisfaction
var.txt: JOBSATIS reports how satisfied the respondent is with his/her current job.

var.name: SATADV
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job's opportunities for advancement
var.txt: SATADV indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's advancement opportunities. SATADV is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

var.name: SATBEN
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job benefits
var.txt: SATBEN indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's benefits. SATBEN is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

var.name: SATCHAL
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job's intellectual challenge
var.txt: SATCHAL indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's intellectual challenge. SATCHAL is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

var.name: SATIND
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job's degree of independence
var.txt: SATIND indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's degree of independence. SATIND is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

var.name: SATLOC
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job's job location
var.txt: SATLOC indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's location. SATLOC is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATRESP, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

var.name: SATRESP
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job's level of responsibility
var.txt: SATRESP indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's level of responsibility. SATRESP is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATSAL, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

var.name: SATSAL
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job salary
var.txt: SATSAL indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's salary. SATSAL is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSEC, and SATSOC.

var.name: SATSEC
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job's job security
var.txt: SATSOC indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with his/her principal job's contribution to society. SATSOC is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, and SATSEC.

var.name: SATSOC
var.labl: Satisfaction principal job's contribution to society
var.txt: SATSOC indicates whether or not the respondent is satisfied with the contribution to society of his/her principal job. SATSOC is part of a series of questions that measures the respondent's satisfaction with certain aspects of his/her principal job. The other variables include SATADV, SATBEN, SATCHAL, SATIND, SATLOC, SATRESP, SATSAL, and SATSEC.

var.name: WKTRNI
var.labl: Attended work-related training
var.txt: WKTRNI indicates whether or not the respondent had attended a work-related training, workshop, or seminar within the last twelve months, not including college coursework towards a degree program.

var.name: WTREASN
var.labl: Most important reason for taking work-related training
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTREASN reports the respondent's most important reason for attending the training.

catgry.labl: To facilitate a change in occupation field
To acquire further skills in my occupational field
To increase opportunities for promotion, advancement, or higher salary
To learn skills needed for a recently acquired position

var.name: WTRADV
var.labl: Reason for attending training: increase advancement opportunities
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRADV indicates whether or not the respondent's reason for attending the training was to increase advancement opportunities. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTRCHG
var.labl: Reason for attending training: facilitate occupation change
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRCHG indicates whether or not the respondent's reason for attending the training was to facilitate an occupation change. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTRCHOC
var.labl: Reason for attending training: facilitate occupation change to different field
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRCHOC indicates whether or not the respondent's reason for attending the training was to facilitate an occupation change in a different field. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTREM
var.labl: Reason for attending training: required/expected by employer
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTREM indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training because it was expected or required from an employer. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTRLIC
var.labl: Reason for attending training: licensure/certification
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRLIC indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training in order to become licensed or certified in a particular skill. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTRNEW
var.labl: Reason for attending training: learn skills for recently acquired position
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRNEW indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training in order to gain skills or knowledge for a recently acquired job. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTROPPS, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTROPPS
var.labl: Reason for attending training: increase advancement opportunities in current occupation
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTROPPS indicates whether or not the respondent attended the training in order to increase opportunities for advancement in the respondent's current position. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROT, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTROT
var.labl: Reason for attending training: other
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTROT indicates whether the respondent had attended the training for a reason other than the options listed in the questionnaire. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTRPERS, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTRPERS
var.labl: Reason for attending training: leisure/personal interest
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRPERS indicates whether the respondent had attended the training for personal interest or leisure. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, and WTRSKL.

var.name: WTRSKL
var.labl: Reason for attending training: acquire further skills/knowledge
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related workshop, seminar, or training, WTRSKL indicates whether the respondent had attended the training in order to improve knowledge or skills relevant to the respondent's current occupational field. Other variables related to the reason for attending a training include WTRADV, WTRCHG, WTRCHOC, WTREM, WTRLIC, WTRNEW, WTROPPS, WTROT, and WTRPERS.

var.name: WTAPRF
var.labl: Area of work-related training: general professional training
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTAPRF indicates whether the respondent had attended a general profession training workshop or seminar. Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTMGT, WTOT, and WTTECH.

var.name: WTMGT
var.labl: Area of work-related training: management training
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTMGT indicates whether the respondent had attended a management training workshop or seminar. Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTAPRF, WTOT, and WTTECH.

var.name: WTOT
var.labl: Area of work-related training: other
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTOT indicates whether the respondent had attended a training that focused on a different topic than management, general professional, or technical training in the respondent's occupational field (which were the only survey responses). Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTAPRF, WTMGT, and WTTECH.

var.name: WTTECH
var.labl: Area of work-related training: technical training
var.txt: If a respondent had attended a work-related training, WTTECH indicates whether the respondent had attended a technical training in the respondent's occupational field. Other variables indicating the type of training a respondent might have taken include WTAPRF, WTMGT, and WTOT.

var.name: OCLIC
var.labl: Licensed/certified in occupation
var.txt: OCLIC indicates whether or not the respondent was licensed and/or certified in his/her occupation.

var.name: MGRNAT
var.labl: Job required technical expertise: natural sciences
var.txt: MGRNAT indicates whether or not the respondent's principal job requires technical expertise at least at the bachelor's degree level in engineering, computer science, math, or natural sciences. The variables MGRSOC and MGROTH indicate expertise requirements in social sciences or other fields, respectively.

var.name: MGROTH
var.labl: Job required technical expertise: other
var.txt: MGROTH indicates whether or not the respondent's principal job requires technical expertise at least at the bachelor's degree level in a field other than the natural or social sciences. The variables MGRNAT and MGRSOC indicate expertise requirements in natural sciences or social sciences, respectively.

var.name: MGRSOC
var.labl: Job required technical expertise: social sciences
var.txt: MGRNAT indicates whether or not the respondent's principal job requires technical expertise at least at the bachelor's degree level in social sciences. The variables MGROTH and MGRNAT indicate expertise requirements in other fields or natural sciences, respectively.

var.name: SPNAT
var.labl: Technical expertise required by spouse/partner job: sciences
var.txt: SPNAT indicates whether or not the job of the respondent's spouse required the spouse to have technical expertise in engineering, computer science, math, or natural sciences at the bachelor degree level or higher. Related variables include SPOT and SPSOC.

var.name: SPOT
var.labl: Technical expertise required by spouse/partner job: other
var.txt: SPOT indicates whether or not the job of the respondent's spouse required the spouse to have technical expertise in a field other than natural or social sciences at the bachelor degree level or higher. Related variables include SPNAT and SPSOC.

var.name: SPSOC
var.labl: Technical expertise required by spouse/partner Job: social sciences
var.txt: SPSOC indicates whether or not the job of the respondent's spouse required the spouse to have technical expertise in social sciences at the bachelor degree level or higher. Related variables include SPNAT and SPOT.

var.name: NOCMLST
var.labl: Job code for last job (major group)
var.txt: NOCMLST categorizes the respondent's last job into seven broad fields. The variable OCLSTPB provides this information with a finer level of detail.

catgry.labl: Biological, agricultural and other life scientists

var.name: OCLSTPB
var.labl: Job code for last job (public use)
var.txt: OCLSTP gives a detailed occupation code for the respondent's previous occupation. NOCMLST is an aggregated version of this variable.

catgry.labl: Top and mid-level managers, executives, administrators
Teachers, except science and engineering postsecondary

var.name: CHCHG
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: change in career/professional interests
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHCHG reports whether or not a change in professional or career interests was a reason for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHCON
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: working conditions
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHCON reports whether or not working conditions were a reason for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHFAM
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: family-related reasons
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHFAM reports whether family-related reasons were among the reasons for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHLAY
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: laid off/job terminated
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHLAY reports whether being laid off or having his/her job terminated was a reason for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHLOC
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: job location
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHLOC reports whether or not the job's location was a reason for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHOT, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHOT
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: other
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHOT indicates that there was a reason for the change in employment other than the reasons listed as options on the questionnaire. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHPAY, CHRET, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHPAY
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: pay, promotion
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHPAY reports whether or not pay or promotion opportunities were a reason for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHRET, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHRET
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: retired
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHRET reports whether or not the respondent's retirement was a reason for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, and CHSCH.

var.name: CHSCH
var.labl: Reason for changing employer or job: school-related reasons
var.txt: If the respondent had changed employers or position within two years of the survey (specifically between October of the survey year and October two years prior), the variable CHSCH reports whether or not school-related reasons were a reason for that change. Other reasons for changing employers or job include CHCHG, CHCON, CHFAM, CHLAY, CHLOC, CHOT, CHPAY, and CHRET.

var.name: BUYOUT
var.labl: Offered buy-out
var.txt: BUYOUT reports whether or not the respondent had ever been offered a buyout, or early retirement in exchange for a cash settlement, by an employer. If yes, the respondent also answered if they accepted the offer or not.

catgry.labl: Yes, but did not accept the offer

var.name: OCOMG
var.labl: Job code for principal job in 1988 (major group)
var.txt: For respondents who were working in April 1988 (5 years prior to the survey), OCOMG reports a broad occupation code for the principal job of the respondent at that time. OCO is a more detailed version of this variable.

var.name: OCO
var.labl: Job code for principal job in 1988
var.txt: For respondents who were working in April 1988 (5 years prior to the survey), OCO reports a detailed occupation code for the principal job of the respondent at that time. OCOMG are aggregated versions of this variable into major occupation groups.

catgry.labl: Top and mid-level managers, executives, administrators
Teachers, except science and engineering postsecondary

var.name: ICOLLAB
var.labl: International collaboration indicator
var.txt: ICOLLAB indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States.

var.name: ICCOMM
var.labl: International collaboration activity: communicate by phone/email
var.txt: ICCOMM indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States using phone and/or email.

var.name: ICTRLA
var.labl: International collaboration activity: travel abroad for collaboration
var.txt: ICTRLA indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States and the respondent traveled abroad for the collaboration.

var.name: ICTRLH
var.labl: International collaboration activity: foreign collaborators travel to US
var.txt: ICTRLH indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States by the international collaborators traveling to the US.

var.name: ICWBVT
var.labl: International collaboration activity: use web-based/virtual technology
var.txt: ICWBVT indicates whether or not a respondent collaborated with other researchers outside of the United States using a web-based or virtual technology.

var.name: NEWRESP
var.labl: New job offered what level of: responsibility
var.txt: For respondents who recently found new job, the variable NEWRESP compares the level of responsibility given in his/her new job to the level of responsibility in his/her previous job. Related variables include NEWSAL and NEWSKILL.

var.name: NEWSAL
var.labl: New job offered what level of: salary
var.txt: For respondents who recently found new job, the variable NEWRESP compares the salary in his/her new job to the salary in his/her previous job. Related variables include NEWRESP and NEWSKILL.

var.name: NEWSKILL
var.labl: New job offered what level of: knowledge/skill utilization
var.txt: For respondents who recently found new job, the variable NEWRESP compares the level of knowledge or skill utilization required in his/her new job to the knowledge or skill utilization required in his/her previous job. Related variables include NEWRESP and NEWSAL.

var.name: NWFAM
var.labl: Reasons for not working: family responsibilities
var.txt: NWFAM indicates whether or not the respondent's family responsibilities were one reason for the respondent not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

var.name: NWILL
var.labl: Reasons for not working: illness/disability
var.txt: NWILL indicates whether or not illness or disability was one reason for the respondent not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

var.name: NWLAY
var.labl: Reasons for not working: layoff
var.txt: NWLAY indicates whether or not being laid off from a previous job was one reason for not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWNOND, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

var.name: NWNOND
var.labl: Reasons for not working: did not need/want to work
var.txt: NWNOND indicates whether or not that the respondent was not working during the reference week because he/she did not need or want to work. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWOCNA, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

var.name: NWOCNA
var.labl: Reasons for not working: suitable job not available
var.txt: NWOCNA indicates whether or not the respondent was not working during the reference week because a suitable job not available. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOTP, NWRET, NWSTU and NWOT.

var.name: NWOT
var.labl: Reasons for not working: other
var.txt:
NWOT indicates whether or not the respondent was not working during the reference week for a reason other than the ones listed in the questionnaire. From 2003-2010 (and S-NSCG 2013), three response options (Illness, Retired and Other) were combined in the SESTAT version of the surveys, see NWOTP.
Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWRET, NWOCNA and NWSTU.

var.name: NWOTP
var.labl: Reasons for not working: illness, retired or other (combined)
var.txt:
NWOTP indicates whether or not illness, retirement or some other reason were causes for not working. This variable combines three response options into one variable (Illness, Retired and Other). In years prior to 2003 (and the 2013 S-SDR), these response options are not combined, see NWILL, NWOT and NWRET.
Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, , NWLAY, NWNOND, , NWOCNA, and NWSTU.

var.name: NWRET
var.labl: Reasons for not working: retired
var.txt: NWRET indicates whether or not that the respondent being retired was one reason for not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWOTP, NWOCNA, NWSTU and NWOT.

var.name: NWSTU
var.labl: Reasons for not working: student
var.txt: NWSTU indicates whether or not that the respondent was student was one reason for not working during the reference week. Other variables from this survey question include NWFAM, NWILL, NWLAY, NWNOND, NWRET, NWOCNA, NWOTP and NWOT.

var.name: HHLOSE
var.labl: Concerned about someone else in household losing job
var.txt: HHLOSE indicates the extent to which the respondent was concerned about another adult in the household losing his/her job. The question explicitly excludes the respondent's concern about his/her own job security.

var.name: HHLOSENO
var.labl: No other working adult in household
var.txt: HHLOSENO indicates whether or not another adult in the respondent's household was working at the time of the survey. Users should note that the response "No" means that another adult was working in the household, and "Yes" means that no other adult in the household was working during the reference period.
